speaker: Martin
text: [_to Eddie_]  Hey, you're lookin' a little under the weather. You all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: He most certainly is not.  He dined on that lovely can of bacon fat you've been hiding under the sink.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez.  Poor little guy.  [_The doorbell rings, Frasier gets up to answer it._]

speaker: Martin
text: You know, bacon grease is bad for dogs.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ironic, considering its vast health benefits for humans.  [_He opens the door to reveal Niles and Daphne.  They come in as everyone greets each other._]

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry we're late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's all right, we're not having lunch until 1:15.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, great.  [_Niles yawns as Martin sits down at the table.  Daphne and Niles sit on the couch._]

speaker: Martin
text: Long night, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, a bit.  We were out at a party last night.

speaker: Daphne
text: At Bill Gates' house.  [_Frasier looks jealous._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Some sort of... charity event?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, just a few people over for dinner.  His wife has been following Maris' case and she wanted to meet us.  It seems the story's captured everyone's imagination and people want to get the inside scoop.

speaker: Daphne
text: Their house is enormous.  I got lost going to the loo, but a voice in the wall guided me back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sounds like fun.  Anyway, I thought after lunch we might stop by the museum for the Goya exhibit.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, we're going tomorrow night with the Blenkinsops.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tomorrow?  But the museum's closed tomorrow.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, not for Bunny and Bruce.  [_Frasier looks put out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, with all the rarified elbows you've been rubbing lately, I'm surprised you could find the time for lunch with a commoner like me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, now stop.  But if we could get going, I have a perfume launch at four.  [_He and Daphne rise.  As they all head for the door, the doorbell rings. Daphne checks the peephole._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's a pretty lady holding some mail.  Oh, you didn't pull that trick again, did you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no idea what you're talking about.  Step aside!  Don't want her to slip it under the door!  [_He pulls her to the side and opens the door to a young woman, Caroline._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Caroline
text: Hi, sorry to disturb you, some of your mail got mixed in with mine.  [_She hands it over._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear, how did that happen?

speaker: Caroline
text: I don't know.  Some of it just seemed to be jammed in there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, huh.  Really, well, we must make allowances for our mailman.  He's a veteran.  So, uh, my name's Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Caroline
text: Caroline Harwich.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice to meet you.  And this is my family.  My father, Martin Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: My sister-in-law, Daphne, and my brother, Niles.

speaker: Caroline
text: You look awfully familiar, have we met?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I am somewhat of a media figure.

speaker: Caroline
text: No, your brother.  Oh, you're Niles Crane from that big murder case.  I saw you on the news.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's been on three times this week.  He's practically famous.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, hardly famous.

speaker: Frasier
text: My brother doesn't like to toot his own horn.  You know, I was discussing that very personality type today on my very popular radio show.

speaker: Caroline
text: Oh, right, right.  Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Caroline
text: Yes, my mother listens to you.  Well, anyway, it was nice meeting you all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, likewise.  [_She turns and leaves.  Frasier closes the door behind her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Isn't it nice to know there are still honest people in the world?

speaker: Martin
text: How come your mail never gets mixed up with that sweaty fat guy's upstairs?

speaker: Niles
text: We should really be going.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  I'm afraid we'll have to be lunching at Vindaloo. I couldn't get us in at Le Toque.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe I should call.  I've had the best luck with restaurants lately.  [_He pulls out his cell phone and dials._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, they swore that they were absolutely booked solid.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear. [_into phone_] Hello?  Yes, wondering if you could possibly squeeze in three for lunch today?  Dr. Crane.  No, actually it's Niles.  Oh, how lovely.  Thank you.  We'll see you in a bit.  [_He disconnects and follows Daphne out.  Frasier shoots a look of injustice at Martin, who just smiles.  Frasier follows his brother. Fade out._]  **BLACK TIE FOR MEN NIGHTGOWNS FOR WOMEN**   [_Fade in.  Frasier is sitting at a table with his coffee.  Roz comes in._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm so sorry about the show.  I was a little distracted.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I sensed that when you patched through Wanda, who wanted to know what our soup of the day was.

speaker: Roz
text: My sister Denise is in town.  I hate it when she visits.  She isn't happy until she makes me feel completely miserable. Do you know what she called my place?  "Cozy."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's a compliment.

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's code for "smaller than hers".  [_to waiter_] Cappuccino, please.  [_She sits_]

speaker: Roz
text: She wraps every insult up in a compliment, and when I try to call her on it she just says "Huh?  I was trying to be nice, you're so sensitive."  And of course, everything in her life is so perfect.  Her home, her husband, the stretch of highway she keeps clean.  She's so competitive.  [_The waiter brings her coffee._]

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if it's any comfort, Niles has been perfectly insufferable of late.  This whole Maris affair has gained him some minor notoriety, he's been... flaunting it like a tattered boa.  I'm trying to do the right thing and rise above it, of course, but there are times I just want to step on his feet.  And hard, too.  [_Roz's sister, Denise, walks in._]

speaker: Roz
text: Denise!  [_Frasier rises to greet her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: How do you do?

speaker: Denise
text: Frasier, hi.  [_She kisses him on the cheek._]  [_N.B. Sometime between "Guilt Trippers," and this episode, Roz probably told Denise that Frasier wasn't her boyfriend Roger._]

speaker: Denise
text: Well, you are looking very distinguished.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  [_She turns to put her coat up as Frasier sits down._]

speaker: Roz
text: That's code for "old".

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.

speaker: Denise
text: I am so sorry I'm late.  Craig called.  The poor thing, he misses me so much it's just impossible to get him off the phone.  [_She sits and grabs a shopping bag._]

speaker: Denise
text: I hope this makes it up to you.  Now, Roz, I know you love your sports wear, but trust me, men like women who wear dresses once in a while.

speaker: Roz
text: So you've said.  [_She takes the bag._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Denise, having fun on your trip?

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, yes.  Staying with Roz is so much fun, it's sort of like camping.  [_Her cell phone rings and she answers._]

speaker: Denise
text: Hello? [_to Frasier_]  It's my contractors.  Take my advice: never build a pool house.  [_She hands a magazine to Roz._]

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, hon?  I picked us up a Seattle Magazine so we can find some fun things to do this week.  [_She gets up, Roz pulls the dress out of the bag._]

speaker: Roz
text: Does that include rolling it up, turning it sideways and....

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Roz.  At least she's trying.  She did get you a gift, after all.  And look, it's very chic and expensive, I'm sure.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, and two sizes too small.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, she's a bitch.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  [_Kenny walks in._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, hey!  It's Mr. SeaBeas!

speaker: Frasier
text: The nominations are in?

speaker: Kenny
text: Yep.  Two of 'em!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yay!  [_Kenny sits._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Actually, Roz, they're both for Frasier.  You're up for best host and best informational special, which gives you the lifetime record for most nominations.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God, I'm, I'm so flattered.  I hope you two will join me at my table.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, those awards are torture, they're endless.  Can I bring my sister?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.  [_Niles walks in, talking on his cell phone._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh look.  It's Niles.

speaker: Kenny
text: You gonna tell him you broke the SeaBeas record?

speaker: Frasier
text: If it comes up.

speaker: Kenny
text: You know, Doc, we should take advantage of this thing.  I got a friend at the Seattle Times who owes me one.  I could ask him to write a big profile on you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, no, Kenny.  Let others engage in that sort of shameless self-promotion.  I'm not interested in playing that sort of game.  Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.  Listen, Frasier, I'm so sorry, I have to cancel tonight. I'm going to hear Tony Bennett.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really.  Where's he playing?

speaker: Niles
text: At Frank Geary's birthday party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, speaking of glamorous parties, Niles, wait until...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, is that Seattle Magazine?  I was hoping you hadn't seen it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Seen what?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, nothing, nothing.  It's a silly thing.  Page thirty.  [_Roz flips to the page as Frasier glowers._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, it's one of those "What's Hot/What's Not" lists.  I love these.  "Heirloom Tomatoes - Hot, Sun Dried Tomatoes - Not".

speaker: Frasier
text: Give me that.  [_He grabs the magazine._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh huh.  "Dr. Niles Crane - Hot, Dr. Frasier Crane..." well, you can see where they're going with this.  Well, we'll just see who's not hot when the winter/spring issue of Seattle Broadcaster comes out.  For your information, Niles, I have recently...  [_Niles cell phone rings._]

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, I am so sorry.  [_He answers it as Kenny gets up._]

speaker: Kenny
text: I'm gonna get some coffee.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?  Hello, Daphne.  A delivery from Bill and Mindy! Aren't they sweet?  [_Frasier quietly fumes._]

speaker: Niles
text: No, don't uncrate it until I get home!  [_He hurries out.  Frasier gets up and goes over to Kenny, who has his cell phone out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, about that article...

speaker: Kenny
text: Way ahead of you, Doc. [_into phone_]  No, he'll make for a great profile: SeaBeas record holder, doctor, big ladies man, the whole ball of wax.  Well, you can ask him yourself.  [_He hands the phone to Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Yes, well, when would be a good time for you?  Oh, I've just had the greatest idea: Why don't you interview me while we're at the SeaBee Awards?  Yes, it will be a freewheeling chat against a glittering backdrop. Splendid!  I will see you anon.  [_He hands the phone back to Kenny and goes back to his table with a smile._]

speaker: Kenny
text: [_into phone_] Hey.  No, he always talks like that.  [_Frasier sits back down next to Roz._]

speaker: Roz
text: Why are you taking him to the SeaBeas?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because I want to see him at my best, Roz.  Do you realize, I'm giving the opening remarks this year?  And if I do say so myself, they will change you.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, from an awake person to a sleeping one.  [_Caroline walks in and Frasier gets a cunning look._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Perfect!  All I was lacking was the appropriate piece of arm candy to accompany me and there she is.

speaker: Roz
text: Who's she?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_]  A neighbor of mine in the building, whose acquaintance I have recently made.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, right, Daphne told me you pulled that old mail trick out of mothballs.  [_Frasier glares, then walks over to Caroline._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Caroline?

speaker: Caroline
text: Frasier, hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, good to see you.

speaker: Caroline
text: Cappuccino, to go.  Thank you so much for those flowers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, it was the least I could do after that stumblebum of a mailman made you do his job for him.

speaker: Caroline
text: Oh, I'd send him a complaint letter if I think he'd get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, delightful.  Listen, I hope this isn't too bold, but you see, I've been nominated for a broadcast award, twice actually, and, well, there's a black tie gala on Saturday night and I was hoping you could accompany me.

speaker: Caroline
text: Thank you, I'd love to.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fantastic.  I'll pick you up around seven-thirty.  [_Caroline turns back to the counter and Frasier goes back to the table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've worked my magic!  That magnificent creature will be accompanying me on Saturday night!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, the awards are Saturday morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... of course they're not.

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, they are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, who would ever plan an awards ceremony on a Saturday morning?

speaker: Roz
text: Kenny was in charge this year, he booked the room too late.  [_Caroline gets her coffee and passes by on her way out._]

speaker: Caroline
text: See you this weekend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, bye-bye.  [_She starts to leave._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't forget I'll pick you up seven-thirty, Saturday morning.  Bye-bye.  [_He holds still, wondering if he got away with it.  Caroline stops at the door and comes back._]   **MISSING**

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_]  I did mention that, didn't I?  Oh, gosh, it seems the SeaBeas is going to be a cheery breakfast event this year.  But the good news is, actually I'll be able to get you home by noon.  Bye-bye.  [_He tries to sit down but Caroline stops him._]

speaker: Caroline
text: I don't think that's going to work for me.  I have Pilates on Saturdays.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, I wish you'd said something sooner.

speaker: Caroline
text: Sorry.  Bye-bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  [_She heads out and he dejectedly sits._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you can't blame her, Frasier.  Who wants to get in hair and makeup at eight in the morning?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, somebody better.  I'm being profiled, it's going to look like I can't even scare up a date.

speaker: Roz
text: You scared that one pretty good.  [_Frasier sits, glowering.  Fade out._]  _Act 2**WANDERING EYE**  Scene 1 - The SeaBea Awards_  [_Fade in.  Frasier is seated at his table in the banquet room, talking on his cell phone._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Cindy, where are you?  Listen, this thing's about to start. Well, I'm sorry you broke your heel, but can't you just put on a different pair of shoes?  Oh, your actual heel. Ouch.  Well, uh, feel better.  [_He hangs up as Roz and Denise come in.  Denise is wearing the dress she gave to Roz._]

speaker: Denise
text: Roz, are you sure this dress didn't fit you?  Because I'm just swimming in it.  [_Roz grabs a passing waiter._]

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, two Bloody Marys, please.  And there's a twenty in it for you if one of 'em's poisoned.  I don't even care which one.  [_Frasier gets up to greet them._]

speaker: Frasier
text: There's a face I'm happy to see.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not you, Roz.  Listen, Denise, uh, could you do me a small favor?

speaker: Denise
text: Mm-hmm?

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, my date didn't show up and there's a reporter here today doing a story on me and could you pretend to be my date?

speaker: Denise
text: Well, sure.  [_They al sit._]

speaker: Denise
text: [_to Roz_]  First the valet hits on me and now this.  [_Roz fumes as Kenny and Martin come over with plates._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hi guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi.

speaker: Martin
text: Some spread.  I got pigs-in-a-blanket lying on an omelet pillow.  And check it out: it snowed cheese.

speaker: Kenny
text: Roz, Larry Gamba couldn't make it, so if he wins can you accept for him?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure, Kenny.  Nothing takes the sting out of not being nominated like accepting an award for my former intern.

speaker: Denise
text: Now, Roz, don't frown.  Those lines don't go away.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, hey there, Randy, over here.  This is the reporter.  [_He and Frasier get up._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Here he is, the Doc himself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely to see you, thanks for coming.

speaker: Kenny
text: And this is Roz Doyle, his ace producer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes and this is my dad, Martin Crane.  Dad, could you move over one for Randall?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure.  [_He and Kenny shift over to make room for Randy._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And I'd like you to meet my date, the lovely and talented Denise Dawson.

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, honey, stop it.  It's a pleasure to meet you.  [_They shake and Frasier and Randy sit down._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, I'm so glad you can join us on our gala morning.

speaker: Randy
text: Is this thing always so early?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but then the SeaBeas have always been the wayward maverick of awards shows.  In fact I kind of touch on that in my opening remarks, while hewing to my original theme: Communication as the Engine of Social Progress.

speaker: Randy
text: Sounds great.  [_grabbing a waiter_]  Could I get a big cup of coffee, please?  [_He jots down some notes while Frasier notices his brother at the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What's Niles doing here?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I gave him Ronee's ticket.  She said she hated to miss 'em but she didn't want to come.  [_Niles comes over._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry I'm late, I had to distribute some sound bites.  [_He sits down, Randall leans across he table to shake his hand._]

speaker: Randy
text: That's quite all right, Dr. Crane, I'm very excited to meet you.  Randall Schoonover, the Seattle Times.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: He's doing a profile of me.  A Day in the Life of Frasier Crane.

speaker: Randy
text: But if there's anything you'd like to tell my readers...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thank you, I'm just here to support my brother.  [_Randy jots this down._]

speaker: Randy
text: Supports his brother.  [_Frasier glares at Niles, then hears some light music._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I guess it's time for me to give my opening remarks.  [_He gets up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You just sit tight and I'll be back in twenty minutes.  [_He walks over to the podium but is stopped by the band leader._]

speaker: Bandleader
text: You want to give me a cue so I know when to play you off stage?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, you will feel the pace quicken as I build to my climax, which is a grim verbal picture of the world without broadcasting.

speaker: Bandleader
text: Just tell me the last words.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll say "Thank you."  [_N.B. The bandleader is the same one from Season 3's[[3.13]](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_13/moon_dance.html "Moon Dance")_]  [_He takes to the stage as the crowd politely claps._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good morning.  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane and it is my great honor to stand before you, my fellow luminaries and welcome you to the Seattle Broadcasting Awards.  I hope to do justice to the dignity of this most august occasion.  [_A chef steps up and whispers in his ear._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I've been asked to inform everyone that we are running low on sausage.  So if you would please limit yourselves to one link or patty.  Thank you.  [_The band strikes up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not finished.  [_A young woman, Plum, comes up to lead him off._]

speaker: Plum
text: Thanks, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.  [_He steps down._]

speaker: Plum
text: Now, who wants to hand out some hardware?  [_Dissolve to - later.  A slide show of people with "IN MEMORIAM" and the dates of their births/deaths below the pictures is shown on a screen._]

speaker: Plum
text: Angela DiStefano, Keith Meebly and Chet Harding, the legendary host of "It's Your Dime".

speaker: Kenny
text: So many greats this year.  [_Frasier brings some orange juice to Denise._]

speaker: Frasier
text: This is for you, my dear.  [_Denise's cell phone rings and she answers it as Frasier sits._]

speaker: Denise
text: Hello?  Oh, hi Craig.  [_to Frasier_]  Honey?  I've got to take this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  Hurry back, love.  [_She gets up and steps away._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Randy, where were we?

speaker: Randy
text: Your brother was just telling me how Maris is coping with jail.  So, is it true that Maris tried to break out?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no, no.  Her eyebrow pencil simply rolled out of her cell and she went to get it.  It's really the jail's fault for making those bars so far apart.  [_Frasier gives Niles a look._]

speaker: Niles
text: This is really my brother's day.

speaker: Plum
text: And now the nominees for best informational special.

speaker: Kenny
text: Doc, this is you!

speaker: Plum
text: Riley Austin for "Underground Skateboarder," Harper Norton for "Inside the Statehouse," and Dr. Frasier Crane for "The Young Person's Guide to Depression."  And the winner is:  Riley Austin!  [_Everyone applauds and a very young man goes up to the stage.  Frasier has a very poor fake smile on his face as he claps.  Randy gets up._]

speaker: Randy
text: I'm just gonna track down some Sweet 'n' Low.  [_He walks away._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, you should have powdered your nose if you planned to spend so much time in my spotlight.

speaker: Niles
text: I was just making conversation!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, stop it!

speaker: Martin
text: Knock it off, you two!  If you can't share this reporter, I'm gonna ask him to leave.

speaker: Kenny
text: Roz, get ready, this is Larry's category.  [_Denise comes back, in tears._]

speaker: Denise
text: I can't believe that this happened.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's all right.  I'm still up for best host.

speaker: Denise
text: Craig is leaving me.

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Denise
text: He met someone else.  I can't believe this is happening to me.

speaker: Plum
text: And the winner is: Larry Gamba for KACL

speaker: Kenny
text: Roz, get up there.

speaker: Denise
text: This is so terrible.

speaker: Roz
text: [_rising_] I know, I know.

speaker: Denise
text: How would you know what it's like to lose a husband, Roz? You never even had one!  [_Roz heads to the stage and takes the award._]

speaker: Plum
text: Accepting the award is Roz Doyle.

speaker: Roz
text: Um, thanks, Plum.  Larry couldn't be here today, but if he were here, he would say, um...  [_She glances at her sobbing sister._]

speaker: Roz
text: "YES!  Thank you, God!  Yes!  This is the best day of my entire life!" [_hugging Plum_] "I've just been waiting for this since I was a little girl.  Yes!  You have no idea how much this means to me!  YES!"  [_The band plays her off as she jumps for joy, shaking everyone's hands._]

speaker: Denise
text: I hate men!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now, Denise....  [_Randall comes back and sits down._]

speaker: Denise
text: Shut up!  You're all the same.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, listen, Denise...  [_He tries to take her hand._]

speaker: Denise
text: Get your hands off me!  Stop it!  [_She breaks into huge sobs.  Frasier notices Randall taking more notes._]

speaker: Frasier
text: There's no need for you to write that down.

speaker: Plum
text: And now the nominees for best radio call-in host...

speaker: Kenny
text: Better get ready, Doc, this one has your name on it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well it better, because this whole show has been a nightmare. Except it can't be a nightmare because it's MID-MORNING!

speaker: Plum
text: And the SeaBea goes to:  the late Chet Harding for "It's Your Dime".

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry, Son, you can't beat a dead guy.

speaker: Denise
text: Dead!  That's the best kind of guy!

speaker: Randy
text: Well, I think maybe I have enough.  [_He gets up, Frasier hurries to head him off._]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, please, don't go.  Listen, the show will be over very soon.  They actually have a bat mitzvah booked for noon so maybe we could finish up in the lobby.

speaker: Randy
text: Okay, I'll get my coat.  I hope you can join us, Niles.  [_He walks off.  Frasier smiles after him, then grabs a chair and sits next to Niles, furious._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you dare!  You have been monopolizing that man's time all morning.

speaker: Niles
text: You should thanking me for distracting him from this circus!

speaker: Frasier
text: You should talk!  You've been the ringmaster of your own media circus for the last week!

speaker: Niles
text: And it's killing you, isn't it?!

speaker: Frasier
text: If you think I am jealous of your tawdry notoriety, then you don't know who I am.

speaker: Niles
text: Just like most of the people in this city!

speaker: Frasier
text: You go too far!  [_He jumps to his feet, knocking his chair backwards, which sends a man stumbling into a waiter, causing a chain reaction into another waiter who flies across a table and knocks over a diner as people scream and gasp.  As Frasier stands there, stunned, Kenny pushes through the crowd to him._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Doc, that's Jerry Edwards.  He's supposed to close the show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is he all right?  [_The man rises, clutching his face._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, no.  You knocked his glass eye out.  Well, you're gonna have to close the show for him.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, you took him out!  And you'll be the only guy in history to open and close the SeaBeas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Nobody's ever done it before?  But...I don't have anything prepared.

speaker: Kenny
text: Don't worry, it's all on the teleprompter.  [_He rushes Frasier to the stage._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Now, get up there and sing.  It's to the tune of "Moon River".  [_As he takes the stage and the band begins playing, Martin turns from the buffet.  There is the clinking sound of glass and he looks down._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, think I just kicked somethin'.

speaker: Frasier
text: The SeaBeas, now are at an end We hope you've made a friend Or two...  [_Denise slaps at Roz, who is trying to comfort her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And the SeaBeas Have great freebies, Just pick up your bag At the door to your right.  [_Most of the guests are searching for the glass eye and ignoring him._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Found it!  [_He triumphantly hold up his hand._]

speaker: Niles
text: That's an olive.

speaker: Frasier
text: The SeaBeas, we hope your day was great, And, yes, we validate, Right there.  [_A valet takes Randy's parking slip.  He tries to catch it back, then just follows him out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: See Rico, Eduardo or Jen, They'll bring it round the bend, A Hyundai or a Benz The SeaBeas are through.  [_Frasier gazes out on the chaos, then just purses his lips and walks off stage.  Fade out._]
